Recent updates View all (41)

October 27

German and French Translations added

Small update today - you can now play Door Kickers in French and German language.

As before, you can help us by reporting any translation issues here: http://steamcommunity.com/app/248610/discussions/1/ or via email (devteam AT inthekillhouse.com)

There's a free steam key waiting for anyone that correctly reports a translation issue that we're able to verify and improve the game with



"Viel glück / Bonne chance!" :)

Your DevTeam @ KillHouse Games

13 comments Read more

October 6

Update! (translations and new content)

Hello, KHG crowd!

First of all, the game has been updated to include localization support. For the moment this includes Spanish, Russian and Polish, with more languages to follow. Help us out by reporting any translation issues in any of the new forums:
On Steam Forums: http://steamcommunity.com/app/248610/discussions/1/
Or via email:devteam@inthekillhouse.com (Pro-tip: write in english for best results, we hardly understand more than Romanian/English/French).

What about other languages?
More are coming but let us know your needs and preferences. Translation mods will now be supported to work directly in the game and we will work with mod makers to help them achieve that.

If you weren't aware, the game is now available also on Android for tablets and large phones: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.khg.doorkickers&hl=en


Now, for the full patch content list:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Features:
- 4 new maps
- 4 new weapons.
- Localization support. Added translations into Russian, Spanish and Polish. More coming.
- Video exporting of replays is now much faster.
- Decreased memory requirements for the game, should no longer cause problems on systems with 2GB RAM.
- Increased font size in several places.

Fixes:
- Stinger grenades will no longer explode through walls.
- Several crashes related to older mods.
- Campaigns page not being displayed correctly in some cases.
- Fixed several bugs related to AI.



Have fun :)

Your DevTeam @ KillHouse Games

24 comments Read more

Reviews

“If you like your puzzles pausable and plausable, your firefights fierce and your tactical options abundant, this is sure to be one of the best things you buy this year.”
Rock, Paper, Shotgun

“Door Kickers is a game about cops kicking down doors, and these doors are a lot of fun to kick down. It is also very hard, and I love it for that.”
84 – PC Gamer

“It’s a thing of beauty and manages to capture the planning and satisfying execution of more complex strategy games, as well as the gung-ho and the popping-off of growly man in military shooters. (...) It’s probably the best man-shootery game I’ve played in years.”
Indie Statik

Steam Workshop

The built in Level and Mission Editor makes it easy to create custom levels and share them with the community. And its easy to create new weapons and gear too, check out the madness in our workshop!

About This Game

Door Kickers is an innovative realtime strategy game that puts you in charge of a SWAT team and lets you command them during a tactical intervention.

Analyze the situation, plan team routes, choose equipment and breach points and coordinate multiple troopers to reach the hostage room before the bad guys get to press that trigger.

It may sound daunting, and like real world CQB combat, it sure is. But most levels can be completed in minutes and on the fly improvisation works. Achieving the perfect planning, getting the mission done with no false steps, that’s a skill harder to master.

Quick Points:

  • 2D, Top Down for optimal tactical analysis
  • Real Time With Free Pause
  • No turns, no hexes, no action points or awkward interfaces
  • Realistic but action packed
  • Non-linear levels, freeform gameplay
  • Mission editor and modability
  • Unlimited gameplay via mission generator and level editor
  • Single Player (but MP might come later)

Read more about the game at http://www.doorkickersgame.com

READ MORE

54 of 55 people (98%) found this review helpful
3
Z0mBi3
1,935 products in account
34 reviews
Recommended
18.8 hrs on record
Posted: July 9
Doorkickers is a 2D, Top Down tactical strategy game with real-time and pause. This title has been on my radar for a very long time and I decided to pick it up during summersale. Now I have finally played it and I have to say that it's great!

If you enjoy games like Xcom you will most likely have fun with doorkickers, or if you have an interest in swat games and tactics planning. This game have so many levels and challenges you can complete. Also there's a story, although it felt just like the normal quick games I would say.

You can also create your own maps and download others for unlimited fun! Save hostages, kill bad guys and capture wanted criminals. Its intense at times but it's always fun to play!

Doorkickers comes with all the neat steam features like achievement, steam cloud, etc. Game runs well and you have a good options menu. You level up your soldiers in game and unlock new classes and weapons.

This game is great and I would strongly recommend everyone to at least try it out at some point. This is one of the only good games that came out of early access!

Kate -> Reddit.com/r/Insurgency
131 products in account
1 review
Recommended
18.7 hrs on record
Posted: May 22
A fun little top-down single-player room clearing game. You usually control a small team, eventually composed of various classes, with a number of tools. You can make elaborate plans and/or clear in real time. Lots of workshop maps. If it's too easy, you can set various challenges for yourself, like tasing and arresting wherever possible instead of shooting, or doing the campaigns with permadeath on for your team members. Seems to be updated periodically. You can pause whenever and leave where you left off, nice when just taking a quick break.

TL;DR: It's groovy.

Ivan
409 products in account
15 reviews
Recommended
5.6 hrs on record
Posted: July 10
Best tactics in 2014 for a reason.

Recommended and gifted by a "friend" of mine (Nanamil) in return for all my collected Friendship tokens.

It's a simple but challenging game from the topdown perspective in wich you take the role of a squad leader guiding a good amount of S.W.A.T's through an almost endless amount of levels (thanks to Steam's Workshop)- each one different in artstyle, size, and possible ways to accomplish the goal.

"But whats the goal?" you might ask now and I dont even feel ashamed saying that its cliche Counter -Terrorist missions such as bomb defusal, hostage rescuing, eliminating all hostiles etc...

But in this game it feels more satisfying than in most games that tried to be tactical or stealth in the past few years (no matter if Topdown, Fps, Third-person ) and thats why I can highly recommend it to a wide range of gamers...those who love Real-Time-Strategy but also those who love stealth or action in general. Its some of the best games for a quick casual "turn-your-head-off" after work / school and kills all the boredom.

And for me it's just even more motivation that most achievments are more of rewards for actually good playing rather than grinding and more grinding and more grinding...

Since I believe this game could run on ANY PC out there you dont need to worry about your Rig...just enjoy it if you like ~5 bucks for many hours of fun seems like a good deal, eh? :P

<-- Definition of happy (::
151 products in account
10 reviews
Recommended
37.6 hrs on record
Posted: June 18
One of the best games i've played in a long time, will be perfect for those nostalgic about the old SWAT games. While being highly addictive, its mechanics are extremely simple and easy to understand. Yet there lies a great challenge in executing them flawlessly, and succeding with your objectives without losing any of your men.
Lots of content in it in form of single missions, campaigns, mod support and mission generator, so there's essentially an endless amounts of mission to go on. There's also some basic customization to get you a bit emotionally attached to your men (and women). However it seems that there are no female voices, so females will report in with male voices.
No mp or coop yet, but I think they are planning to add that after phone versions release.

Sidenote: If you use steam overlay a lot keep in mind that the shift key locks the path, so after you've been to the overlay press shift once to make the controls normal again.

Artozis
778 products in account
43 reviews
Recommended
3.6 hrs on record
Posted: June 23
Door Kickers - excellent tactical strategy from Romanian developers.

It teach us how to go into the little-known areas. First, we start to play as 2-3 SWAT soldiers and go through all missions quite easily. The next step we are going to manage a bigger team, and solve more complex problems. We can take missions by rush, blowing up the door to throw flashes and grenades. We can equip our soldiers with shields so that they can take damage themselves or we can pass the mission without making a noise. This makes it easy to get to the goal. Also in the game we can give orders in pause mode, it allows us to consider how best, and without loss achieve our goal. This game is very addictive for fans of this genre. Romanian developers have shown that they can make quality tactical game. The game is definitely worth the money.

Good:
A lot of tactical possibilities
Many different missions + Campaigns
Workshop support
Level editor
Each Attempt of passage - different points of respawns of enemies

Bad:
Sometimes crowds of opponents congregate in one room

Total: 9/10

If you like this review, you can read more in our group: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/ArtGamesSteam#curation
